14#ifndef DNS_DB_H
15#define DNS_DB_H 1
16
17/*****
18 ***** Module Info
19 *****/
20
21/*! \file dns/db.h
22 * \brief
23 * The DNS DB interface allows named rdatasets to be stored and retrieved.
24 *
25 * The dns_db_t type is like a "virtual class". To actually use
26 * DBs, an implementation of the class is required.
27 *
28 * XXX more XXX
29 *
30 * MP:
31 * \li The module ensures appropriate synchronization of data structures it
32 * creates and manipulates.
33 *
34 * Reliability:
35 * \li No anticipated impact.
36 *
37 * Resources:
38 * \li TBS
39 *
40 * Security:
41 * \li No anticipated impact.
42 *
43 * Standards:
44 * \li None.
45 */
46
47/*****
48 ***** Imports
49 *****/
50
51#include <inttypes.h>
52#include <stdbool.h>
53
54#include <isc/deprecated.h>
55#include <isc/lang.h>
56#include <isc/magic.h>
57#include <isc/stats.h>
58#include <isc/stdtime.h>
59
60#include <dns/clientinfo.h>
61#include <dns/fixedname.h>
62#include <dns/name.h>
63#include <dns/rdata.h>
64#include <dns/rdataset.h>
65#include <dns/types.h>
66

70 ***** Types
71 *****/

73typedef struct dns_dbmethods {
74 void (*attach)(dns_db_t *source, dns_db_t **targetp);
75 void (*detach)(dns_db_t **dbp);
76 isc_result_t (*beginload)(dns_db_t *db,
77 dns_rdatacallbacks_t *callbacks);
78 isc_result_t (*endload)(dns_db_t *db,
79 dns_rdatacallbacks_t *callbacks);
80 isc_result_t (*serialize)(dns_db_t *db,
81 dns_dbversion_t *version, FILE *file);
82 isc_result_t (*dump)(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *version,
83 const char *filename,
84 dns_masterformat_t masterformat);
85 void (*currentversion)(dns_db_t *db,
86 dns_dbversion_t **versionp);
87 isc_result_t (*newversion)(dns_db_t *db,
88 dns_dbversion_t **versionp);
89 void (*attachversion)(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *source,
90 dns_dbversion_t **targetp);
91 void (*closeversion)(dns_db_t *db,
92 dns_dbversion_t **versionp,
93 bool commit);
94 isc_result_t (*findnode)(dns_db_t *db, const dns_name_t *name,
95 bool create,
96 dns_dbnode_t **nodep);
97 isc_result_t (*find)(dns_db_t *db, const dns_name_t *name,
98 dns_dbversion_t *version,
99 dns_rdatatype_t type, unsigned int options,
100 isc_stdtime_t now,
101 dns_dbnode_t **nodep, dns_name_t *foundname,
102 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
103 dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset);
104 isc_result_t (*findzonecut)(dns_db_t *db, const dns_name_t *name,
105 unsigned int options, isc_stdtime_t now,
106 dns_dbnode_t **nodep,
107 dns_name_t *foundname,
108 dns_name_t *dcname,
109 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
110 dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset);
111 void (*attachnode)(dns_db_t *db,
112 dns_dbnode_t *source,
113 dns_dbnode_t **targetp);
114 void (*detachnode)(dns_db_t *db,
115 dns_dbnode_t **targetp);
116 isc_result_t (*expirenode)(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t *node,
117 isc_stdtime_t now);
118 void (*printnode)(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t *node,
119 FILE *out);
120 isc_result_t (*createiterator)(dns_db_t *db, unsigned int options,
121 dns_dbiterator_t **iteratorp);
122 isc_result_t (*findrdataset)(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t *node,
123 dns_dbversion_t *version,
124 dns_rdatatype_t type,
125 dns_rdatatype_t covers,
126 isc_stdtime_t now,
127 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
128 dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset);
129 isc_result_t (*allrdatasets)(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t *node,
130 dns_dbversion_t *version,
131 isc_stdtime_t now,
132 dns_rdatasetiter_t **iteratorp);
133 isc_result_t (*addrdataset)(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t *node,
134 dns_dbversion_t *version,
135 isc_stdtime_t now,
136 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
137 unsigned int options,
138 dns_rdataset_t *addedrdataset);
139 isc_result_t (*subtractrdataset)(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t *node,
140 dns_dbversion_t *version,
141 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
142 unsigned int options,
143 dns_rdataset_t *newrdataset);
144 isc_result_t (*deleterdataset)(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t *node,
145 dns_dbversion_t *version,
146 dns_rdatatype_t type,
147 dns_rdatatype_t covers);
148 bool (*issecure)(dns_db_t *db);
149 unsigned int (*nodecount)(dns_db_t *db);
150 bool (*ispersistent)(dns_db_t *db);
151 void (*overmem)(dns_db_t *db, bool overmem);
152 void (*settask)(dns_db_t *db, isc_task_t *);
153 isc_result_t (*getoriginnode)(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t **nodep);
154 void (*transfernode)(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t **sourcep,
155 dns_dbnode_t **targetp);
156 isc_result_t (*getnsec3parameters)(dns_db_t *db,
157 dns_dbversion_t *version,
158 dns_hash_t *hash,
159 uint8_t *flags,
160 uint16_t *iterations,
161 unsigned char *salt,
162 size_t *salt_len);
163 isc_result_t (*findnsec3node)(dns_db_t *db, const dns_name_t *name,
164 bool create,
165 dns_dbnode_t **nodep);
166 isc_result_t (*setsigningtime)(dns_db_t *db,
167 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
168 isc_stdtime_t resign);
169 isc_result_t (*getsigningtime)(dns_db_t *db,
170 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
171 dns_name_t *name);
172 void (*resigned)(dns_db_t *db, dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
173 dns_dbversion_t *version);
174 bool (*isdnssec)(dns_db_t *db);
175 dns_stats_t *(*getrrsetstats)(dns_db_t *db);
176 void (*rpz_attach)(dns_db_t *db, void *rpzs,
177 uint8_t rpz_num);
178 isc_result_t (*rpz_ready)(dns_db_t *db);
179 isc_result_t (*findnodeext)(dns_db_t *db, const dns_name_t *name,
180 bool create,
181 dns_clientinfomethods_t *methods,
182 dns_clientinfo_t *clientinfo,
183 dns_dbnode_t **nodep);
184 isc_result_t (*findext)(dns_db_t *db, const dns_name_t *name,
185 dns_dbversion_t *version,
186 dns_rdatatype_t type, unsigned int options,
187 isc_stdtime_t now,
188 dns_dbnode_t **nodep, dns_name_t *foundname,
189 dns_clientinfomethods_t *methods,
190 dns_clientinfo_t *clientinfo,
191 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
192 dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset);
193 isc_result_t (*setcachestats)(dns_db_t *db, isc_stats_t *stats);
194 size_t (*hashsize)(dns_db_t *db);
195 isc_result_t (*nodefullname)(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t *node,
196 dns_name_t *name);
197 isc_result_t (*getsize)(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *version,
198 uint64_t *records, uint64_t *bytes);
199 isc_result_t (*setservestalettl)(dns_db_t *db, dns_ttl_t ttl);
200 isc_result_t (*getservestalettl)(dns_db_t *db, dns_ttl_t *ttl);
201 isc_result_t (*setgluecachestats)(dns_db_t *db, isc_stats_t *stats);
202} dns_dbmethods_t;
203
204typedef isc_result_t
205(*dns_dbcreatefunc_t)(isc_mem_t *mctx, const dns_name_t *name,
206 dns_dbtype_t type, dns_rdataclass_t rdclass,
207 unsigned int argc, char *argv[], void *driverarg,
208 dns_db_t **dbp);
209
210typedef isc_result_t
211(*dns_dbupdate_callback_t)(dns_db_t *db, void *fn_arg);
212
213#define DNS_DB_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('D','N','S','D')
214#define DNS_DB_VALID(db) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(db, DNS_DB_MAGIC)
215
216/*%
217 * This structure is actually just the common prefix of a DNS db
218 * implementation's version of a dns_db_t.
219 * \brief
220 * Direct use of this structure by clients is forbidden. DB implementations
221 * may change the structure. 'magic' must be DNS_DB_MAGIC for any of the
222 * dns_db_ routines to work. DB implementations must maintain all DB
223 * invariants.
224 */
225struct dns_db {
226 unsigned int magic;
227 unsigned int impmagic;
228 dns_dbmethods_t * methods;
229 uint16_t attributes;
230 dns_rdataclass_t rdclass;
231 dns_name_t origin;
232 isc_mem_t * mctx;
233 ISC_LIST(dns_dbonupdatelistener_t) update_listeners;
234};
235
236#define DNS_DBATTR_CACHE 0x01
237#define DNS_DBATTR_STUB 0x02
238
239struct dns_dbonupdatelistener {
240 dns_dbupdate_callback_t onupdate;
241 void * onupdate_arg;
242 ISC_LINK(dns_dbonupdatelistener_t) link;
243};
244
245/*@{*/
246/*%
247 * Options that can be specified for dns_db_find().
248 */
249#define DNS_DBFIND_GLUEOK 0x0001
250#define DNS_DBFIND_VALIDATEGLUE 0x0002
251#define DNS_DBFIND_NOWILD 0x0004
252#define DNS_DBFIND_PENDINGOK 0x0008
253#define DNS_DBFIND_NOEXACT 0x0010
254#define DNS_DBFIND_FORCENSEC 0x0020
255#define DNS_DBFIND_COVERINGNSEC 0x0040
256#define DNS_DBFIND_FORCENSEC3 0x0080
257#define DNS_DBFIND_ADDITIONALOK 0x0100
258#define DNS_DBFIND_NOZONECUT 0x0200
259#define DNS_DBFIND_STALEOK 0x0400
260/*@}*/
261
262/*@{*/
263/*%
264 * Options that can be specified for dns_db_addrdataset().
265 */
266#define DNS_DBADD_MERGE 0x01
267#define DNS_DBADD_FORCE 0x02
268#define DNS_DBADD_EXACT 0x04
269#define DNS_DBADD_EXACTTTL 0x08
270#define DNS_DBADD_PREFETCH 0x10
271/*@}*/
272
273/*%
274 * Options that can be specified for dns_db_subtractrdataset().
275 */
276#define DNS_DBSUB_EXACT 0x01
277#define DNS_DBSUB_WANTOLD 0x02
278
279/*@{*/
280/*%
281 * Iterator options
282 */
283#define DNS_DB_RELATIVENAMES 0x1
284#define DNS_DB_NSEC3ONLY 0x2
285#define DNS_DB_NONSEC3 0x4
286/*@}*/
287
288/*****
289 ***** Methods
290 *****/
291
292/***
293 *** Basic DB Methods
294 ***/
295
296isc_result_t
297dns_db_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, const char *db_type, const dns_name_t *origin,
298 dns_dbtype_t type, dns_rdataclass_t rdclass,
299 unsigned int argc, char *argv[], dns_db_t **dbp);
300/*%<
301 * Create a new database using implementation 'db_type'.
302 *
303 * Notes:
304 * \li All names in the database must be subdomains of 'origin' and in class
305 * 'rdclass'. The database makes its own copy of the origin, so the
306 * caller may do whatever they like with 'origin' and its storage once the
307 * call returns.
308 *
309 * \li DB implementation-specific parameters are passed using argc and argv.
310 *
311 * Requires:
312 *
313 * \li dbp != NULL and *dbp == NULL
314 *
315 * \li 'origin' is a valid absolute domain name.
316 *
317 * \li mctx is a valid memory context
318 *
319 * Ensures:
320 *
321 * \li A copy of 'origin' has been made for the databases use, and the
322 * caller is free to do whatever they want with the name and storage
323 * associated with 'origin'.
324 *
325 * Returns:
326 *
327 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
328 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
329 * \li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND db_type not found
330 *
331 * \li Many other errors are possible, depending on what db_type was
332 * specified.
333 */
334
335void
336dns_db_attach(dns_db_t *source, dns_db_t **targetp);
337/*%<
338 * Attach *targetp to source.
339 *
340 * Requires:
341 *
342 * \li 'source' is a valid database.
343 *
344 * \li 'targetp' points to a NULL dns_db_t *.
345 *
346 * Ensures:
347 *
348 * \li *targetp is attached to source.
349 */
350
351void
352dns_db_detach(dns_db_t **dbp);
353/*%<
354 * Detach *dbp from its database.
355 *
356 * Requires:
357 *
358 * \li 'dbp' points to a valid database.
359 *
360 * Ensures:
361 *
362 * \li *dbp is NULL.
363 *
364 * \li If '*dbp' is the last reference to the database,
365 * all resources used by the database will be freed
366 */
367
368bool
369dns_db_iscache(dns_db_t *db);
370/*%<
371 * Does 'db' have cache semantics?
372 *
373 * Requires:
374 *
375 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
376 *
377 * Returns:
378 * \li #true 'db' has cache semantics
379 * \li #false otherwise
380 */
381
382bool
383dns_db_iszone(dns_db_t *db);
384/*%<
385 * Does 'db' have zone semantics?
386 *
387 * Requires:
388 *
389 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
390 *
391 * Returns:
392 * \li #true 'db' has zone semantics
393 * \li #false otherwise
394 */
395
396bool
397dns_db_isstub(dns_db_t *db);
398/*%<
399 * Does 'db' have stub semantics?
400 *
401 * Requires:
402 *
403 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
404 *
405 * Returns:
406 * \li #true 'db' has zone semantics
407 * \li #false otherwise
408 */
409
410bool
411dns_db_issecure(dns_db_t *db);
412/*%<
413 * Is 'db' secure?
414 *
415 * Requires:
416 *
417 * \li 'db' is a valid database with zone semantics.
418 *
419 * Returns:
420 * \li #true 'db' is secure.
421 * \li #false 'db' is not secure.
422 */
423
424bool
425dns_db_isdnssec(dns_db_t *db);
426/*%<
427 * Is 'db' secure or partially secure?
428 *
429 * Requires:
430 *
431 * \li 'db' is a valid database with zone semantics.
432 *
433 * Returns:
434 * \li #true 'db' is secure or is partially.
435 * \li #false 'db' is not secure.
436 */
437
438dns_name_t *
439dns_db_origin(dns_db_t *db);
440/*%<
441 * The origin of the database.
442 *
443 * Note: caller must not try to change this name.
444 *
445 * Requires:
446 *
447 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
448 *
449 * Returns:
450 *
451 * \li The origin of the database.
452 */
453
454dns_rdataclass_t
455dns_db_class(dns_db_t *db);
456/*%<
457 * The class of the database.
458 *
459 * Requires:
460 *
461 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
462 *
463 * Returns:
464 *
465 * \li The class of the database.
466 */
467
468isc_result_t
469dns_db_beginload(dns_db_t *db, dns_rdatacallbacks_t *callbacks);
470/*%<
471 * Begin loading 'db'.
472 *
473 * Requires:
474 *
475 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
476 *
477 * \li This is the first attempt to load 'db'.
478 *
479 * \li 'callbacks' is a pointer to an initialized dns_rdatacallbacks_t
480 * structure.
481 *
482 * Ensures:
483 *
484 * \li On success, callbacks->add will be a valid dns_addrdatasetfunc_t
485 * suitable for loading records into 'db' from a raw or text zone
486 * file. callbacks->add_private will be a valid DB load context
487 * which should be used as 'arg' when callbacks->add is called.
488 * callbacks->deserialize will be a valid dns_deserialize_func_t
489 * suitable for loading 'db' from a map format zone file.
490 *
491 * Returns:
492 *
493 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
494 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
495 *
496 * \li Other results are possible, depending upon the database
497 * implementation used, syntax errors in the master file, etc.
498 */
499
500isc_result_t
501dns_db_endload(dns_db_t *db, dns_rdatacallbacks_t *callbacks);
502/*%<
503 * Finish loading 'db'.
504 *
505 * Requires:
506 *
507 * \li 'db' is a valid database that is being loaded.
508 *
509 * \li 'callbacks' is a valid dns_rdatacallbacks_t structure.
510 *
511 * \li callbacks->add_private is not NULL and is a valid database load context.
512 *
513 * Ensures:
514 *
515 * \li 'callbacks' is returned to its state prior to calling dns_db_beginload()
516 *
517 * Returns:
518 *
519 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
520 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
521 *
522 * \li Other results are possible, depending upon the database
523 * implementation used, syntax errors in the master file, etc.
524 */
525
526isc_result_t
527dns_db_load(dns_db_t *db, const char *filename, dns_masterformat_t format,
528 unsigned int options);
529/*%<
530 * Load master file 'filename' into 'db'.
531 *
532 * Notes:
533 * \li This routine is equivalent to calling
534 *
535 *\code
536 * dns_db_beginload();
537 * dns_master_loadfile();
538 * dns_db_endload();
539 *\endcode
540 *
541 * Requires:
542 *
543 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
544 *
545 * \li This is the first attempt to load 'db'.
546 *
547 * Returns:
548 *
549 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
550 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
551 *
552 * \li Other results are possible, depending upon the database
553 * implementation used, syntax errors in the master file, etc.
554 */
555
556isc_result_t
557dns_db_serialize(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *version, FILE *rbtfile);
558/*%<
559 * Dump version 'version' of 'db' to map-format file 'filename'.
560 *
561 * Requires:
562 *
563 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
564 *
565 * \li 'version' is a valid version.
566 *
567 * Returns:
568 *
569 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
570 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
571 *
572 * \li Other results are possible, depending upon the database
573 * implementation used, OS file errors, etc.
574 */
575
576isc_result_t
577dns_db_dump(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *version, const char *filename);
578/*%<
579 * Dump version 'version' of 'db' to master file 'filename'.
580 *
581 * Requires:
582 *
583 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
584 *
585 * \li 'version' is a valid version.
586 *
587 * Returns:
588 *
589 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
590 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
591 *
592 * \li Other results are possible, depending upon the database
593 * implementation used, OS file errors, etc.
594 */
595
596/***
597 *** Version Methods
598 ***/
599
600void
601dns_db_currentversion(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t **versionp);
602/*%<
603 * Open the current version for reading.
604 *
605 * Requires:
606 *
607 * \li 'db' is a valid database with zone semantics.
608 *
609 * \li versionp != NULL && *verisonp == NULL
610 *
611 * Ensures:
612 *
613 * \li On success, '*versionp' is attached to the current version.
614 *
615 */
616
617isc_result_t
618dns_db_newversion(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t **versionp);
619/*%<
620 * Open a new version for reading and writing.
621 *
622 * Requires:
623 *
624 * \li 'db' is a valid database with zone semantics.
625 *
626 * \li versionp != NULL && *verisonp == NULL
627 *
628 * Ensures:
629 *
630 * \li On success, '*versionp' is attached to the current version.
631 *
632 * Returns:
633 *
634 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
635 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
636 *
637 * \li Other results are possible, depending upon the database
638 * implementation used.
639 */
640
641void
642dns_db_attachversion(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *source,
643 dns_dbversion_t **targetp);
644/*%<
645 * Attach '*targetp' to 'source'.
646 *
647 * Requires:
648 *
649 * \li 'db' is a valid database with zone semantics.
650 *
651 * \li source is a valid open version
652 *
653 * \li targetp != NULL && *targetp == NULL
654 *
655 * Ensures:
656 *
657 * \li '*targetp' is attached to source.
658 */
659
660void
661dns_db_closeversion(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t **versionp,
662 bool commit);
663/*%<
664 * Close version '*versionp'.
665 *
666 * Note: if '*versionp' is a read-write version and 'commit' is true,
667 * then all changes made in the version will take effect, otherwise they
668 * will be rolled back. The value of 'commit' is ignored for read-only
669 * versions.
670 *
671 * Requires:
672 *
673 * \li 'db' is a valid database with zone semantics.
674 *
675 * \li '*versionp' refers to a valid version.
676 *
677 * \li If committing a writable version, then there must be no other
678 * outstanding references to the version (e.g. an active rdataset
679 * iterator).
680 *
681 * Ensures:
682 *
683 * \li *versionp == NULL
684 *
685 * \li If *versionp is a read-write version, and commit is true, then
686 * the version will become the current version. If !commit, then all
687 * changes made in the version will be undone, and the version will
688 * not become the current version.
689 */
690
691/***
692 *** Node Methods
693 ***/
694
695isc_result_t
696dns_db_findnode(dns_db_t *db, const dns_name_t *name, bool create,
697 dns_dbnode_t **nodep);
698
699isc_result_t
700dns_db_findnodeext(dns_db_t *db, const dns_name_t *name, bool create,
701 dns_clientinfomethods_t *methods,
702 dns_clientinfo_t *clientinfo, dns_dbnode_t **nodep);
703/*%<
704 * Find the node with name 'name'.
705 *
706 * dns_db_findnodeext() (findnode extended) also accepts parameters
707 * 'methods' and 'clientinfo', which, when provided, enable the database to
708 * retreive information about the client from the caller, and modify its
709 * response on the basis of that information.
710 *
711 * Notes:
712 * \li If 'create' is true and no node with name 'name' exists, then
713 * such a node will be created.
714 *
715 * \li This routine is for finding or creating a node with the specified
716 * name. There are no partial matches. It is not suitable for use
717 * in building responses to ordinary DNS queries; clients which wish
718 * to do that should use dns_db_find() instead.
719 *
720 * Requires:
721 *
722 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
723 *
724 * \li 'name' is a valid, non-empty, absolute name.
725 *
726 * \li nodep != NULL && *nodep == NULL
727 *
728 * Ensures:
729 *
730 * \li On success, *nodep is attached to the node with name 'name'.
731 *
732 * Returns:
733 *
734 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
735 * \li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND If !create and name not found.
736 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY Can only happen if create is true.
737 *
738 * \li Other results are possible, depending upon the database
739 * implementation used.
740 */
741
742isc_result_t
743dns_db_find(dns_db_t *db, const dns_name_t *name, dns_dbversion_t *version,
744 dns_rdatatype_t type, unsigned int options, isc_stdtime_t now,
745 dns_dbnode_t **nodep, dns_name_t *foundname,
746 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset, dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset);
747
748isc_result_t
749dns_db_findext(dns_db_t *db, const dns_name_t *name, dns_dbversion_t *version,
750 dns_rdatatype_t type, unsigned int options, isc_stdtime_t now,
751 dns_dbnode_t **nodep, dns_name_t *foundname,
752 dns_clientinfomethods_t *methods, dns_clientinfo_t *clientinfo,
753 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset, dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset);
754/*%<
755 * Find the best match for 'name' and 'type' in version 'version' of 'db'.
756 *
757 * dns_db_findext() (find extended) also accepts parameters 'methods'
758 * and 'clientinfo', which when provided enable the database to retreive
759 * information about the client from the caller, and modify its response
760 * on the basis of this information.
761 *
762 * Notes:
763 *
764 * \li If type == dns_rdataset_any, then rdataset will not be bound.
765 *
766 * \li If 'options' does not have #DNS_DBFIND_GLUEOK set, then no glue will
767 * be returned. For zone databases, glue is as defined in RFC2181.
768 * For cache databases, glue is any rdataset with a trust of
769 * dns_trust_glue.
770 *
771 * \li If 'options' does not have #DNS_DBFIND_ADDITIONALOK set, then no
772 * additional records will be returned. Only caches can have
773 * rdataset with trust dns_trust_additional.
774 *
775 * \li If 'options' does not have #DNS_DBFIND_PENDINGOK set, then no
776 * pending data will be returned. This option is only meaningful for
777 * cache databases.
778 *
779 * \li If the #DNS_DBFIND_NOWILD option is set, then wildcard matching will
780 * be disabled. This option is only meaningful for zone databases.
781 *
782 * \li If the #DNS_DBFIND_NOZONECUT option is set, the database is
783 * assumed to contain no zone cuts above 'name'. An implementation
784 * may therefore choose to search for a match beginning at 'name'
785 * rather than walking down the tree to check check for delegations.
786 * If #DNS_DBFIND_NOWILD is not set, wildcard matching will be
787 * attempted at each node starting at the direct ancestor of 'name'
788 * and working up to the zone origin. This option is only meaningful
789 * when querying redirect zones.
790 *
791 * \li If the #DNS_DBFIND_FORCENSEC option is set, the database is assumed to
792 * have NSEC records, and these will be returned when appropriate. This
793 * is only necessary when querying a database that was not secure
794 * when created.
795 *
796 * \li If the DNS_DBFIND_COVERINGNSEC option is set, then look for a
797 * NSEC record that potentially covers 'name' if a answer cannot
798 * be found. Note the returned NSEC needs to be checked to ensure
799 * that it is correct. This only affects answers returned from the
800 * cache.
801 *
802 * \li If the #DNS_DBFIND_FORCENSEC3 option is set, then we are looking
803 * in the NSEC3 tree and not the main tree. Without this option being
804 * set NSEC3 records will not be found.
805 *
806 * \li To respond to a query for SIG records, the caller should create a
807 * rdataset iterator and extract the signatures from each rdataset.
808 *
809 * \li Making queries of type ANY with #DNS_DBFIND_GLUEOK is not recommended,
810 * because the burden of determining whether a given rdataset is valid
811 * glue or not falls upon the caller.
812 *
813 * \li The 'now' field is ignored if 'db' is a zone database. If 'db' is a
814 * cache database, an rdataset will not be found unless it expires after
815 * 'now'. Any ANY query will not match unless at least one rdataset at
816 * the node expires after 'now'. If 'now' is zero, then the current time
817 * will be used.
818 *
819 * Requires:
820 *
821 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
822 *
823 * \li 'type' is not SIG, or a meta-RR type other than 'ANY' (e.g. 'OPT').
824 *
825 * \li 'nodep' is NULL, or nodep is a valid pointer and *nodep == NULL.
826 *
827 * \li 'foundname' is a valid name with a dedicated buffer.
828 *
829 * \li 'rdataset' is NULL, or is a valid unassociated rdataset.
830 *
831 * Ensures,
832 * on a non-error completion:
833 *
834 * \li If nodep != NULL, then it is bound to the found node.
835 *
836 * \li If foundname != NULL, then it contains the full name of the
837 * found node.
838 *
839 * \li If rdataset != NULL and type != dns_rdatatype_any, then
840 * rdataset is bound to the found rdataset.
841 *
842 * Non-error results are:
843 *
844 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS The desired node and type were
845 * found.
846 *
847 * \li #DNS_R_GLUE The desired node and type were
848 * found, but are glue. This
849 * result can only occur if
850 * the DNS_DBFIND_GLUEOK option
851 * is set. This result can only
852 * occur if 'db' is a zone
853 * database. If type ==
854 * dns_rdatatype_any, then the
855 * node returned may contain, or
856 * consist entirely of invalid
857 * glue (i.e. data occluded by a
858 * zone cut). The caller must
859 * take care not to return invalid
860 * glue to a client.
861 *
862 * \li #DNS_R_DELEGATION The data requested is beneath
863 * a zone cut. node, foundname,
864 * and rdataset reference the
865 * NS RRset of the zone cut.
866 * If 'db' is a cache database,
867 * then this is the deepest known
868 * delegation.
869 *
870 * \li #DNS_R_ZONECUT type == dns_rdatatype_any, and
871 * the desired node is a zonecut.
872 * The caller must take care not
873 * to return inappropriate glue
874 * to a client. This result can
875 * only occur if 'db' is a zone
876 * database and DNS_DBFIND_GLUEOK
877 * is set.
878 *
879 * \li #DNS_R_DNAME The data requested is beneath
880 * a DNAME. node, foundname,
881 * and rdataset reference the
882 * DNAME RRset.
883 *
884 * \li #DNS_R_CNAME The rdataset requested was not
885 * found, but there is a CNAME
886 * at the desired name. node,
887 * foundname, and rdataset
888 * reference the CNAME RRset.
889 *
890 * \li #DNS_R_NXDOMAIN The desired name does not
891 * exist.
892 *
893 * \li #DNS_R_NXRRSET The desired name exists, but
894 * the desired type does not.
895 *
896 * \li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND The desired name does not
897 * exist, and no delegation could
898 * be found. This result can only
899 * occur if 'db' is a cache
900 * database. The caller should
901 * use its nameserver(s) of last
902 * resort (e.g. root hints).
903 *
904 * \li #DNS_R_NCACHENXDOMAIN The desired name does not
905 * exist. 'node' is bound to the
906 * cache node with the desired
907 * name, and 'rdataset' contains
908 * the negative caching proof.
909 *
910 * \li #DNS_R_NCACHENXRRSET The desired type does not
911 * exist. 'node' is bound to the
912 * cache node with the desired
913 * name, and 'rdataset' contains
914 * the negative caching proof.
915 *
916 * \li #DNS_R_EMPTYNAME The name exists but there is
917 * no data at the name.
918 *
919 * \li #DNS_R_COVERINGNSEC The returned data is a NSEC
920 * that potentially covers 'name'.
921 *
922 * \li #DNS_R_EMPTYWILD The name is a wildcard without
923 * resource records.
924 *
925 * Error results:
926 *
927 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
928 *
929 * \li #DNS_R_BADDB Data that is required to be
930 * present in the DB, e.g. an NSEC
931 * record in a secure zone, is not
932 * present.
933 *
934 * \li Other results are possible, and should all be treated as
935 * errors.
936 */
937
938isc_result_t
939dns_db_findzonecut(dns_db_t *db, const dns_name_t *name,
940 unsigned int options, isc_stdtime_t now,
941 dns_dbnode_t **nodep, dns_name_t *foundname,
942 dns_name_t *dcname, dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
943 dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset);
944/*%<
945 * Find the deepest known zonecut which encloses 'name' in 'db'.
946 *
947 * Notes:
948 *
949 * \li If the #DNS_DBFIND_NOEXACT option is set, then the zonecut returned
950 * (if any) will be the deepest known ancestor of 'name'.
951 *
952 * \li If 'now' is zero, then the current time will be used.
953 *
954 * Requires:
955 *
956 * \li 'db' is a valid database with cache semantics.
957 *
958 * \li 'nodep' is NULL, or nodep is a valid pointer and *nodep == NULL.
959 *
960 * \li 'foundname' is a valid name with a dedicated buffer.
961 *
962 * \li 'dcname' is a valid name with a dedicated buffer.
963 *
964 * \li 'rdataset' is NULL, or is a valid unassociated rdataset.
965 *
966 * Ensures, on a non-error completion:
967 *
968 * \li If nodep != NULL, then it is bound to the found node.
969 *
970 * \li If foundname != NULL, then it contains the full name of the
971 * found node.
972 *
973 * \li If dcname != NULL, then it contains the deepest cached name
974 * that exists in the database.
975 *
976 * \li If rdataset != NULL and type != dns_rdatatype_any, then
977 * rdataset is bound to the found rdataset.
978 *
979 * Non-error results are:
980 *
981 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
982 *
983 * \li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND
984 *
985 * \li Other results are possible, and should all be treated as
986 * errors.
987 */
988
989void
990dns_db_attachnode(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t *source, dns_dbnode_t **targetp);
991/*%<
992 * Attach *targetp to source.
993 *
994 * Requires:
995 *
996 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
997 *
998 * \li 'source' is a valid node.
999 *
1000 * \li 'targetp' points to a NULL dns_dbnode_t *.
1001 *
1002 * Ensures:
1003 *
1004 * \li *targetp is attached to source.
1005 */
1006
1007void
1008dns_db_detachnode(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t **nodep);
1009/*%<
1010 * Detach *nodep from its node.
1011 *
1012 * Requires:
1013 *
1014 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
1015 *
1016 * \li 'nodep' points to a valid node.
1017 *
1018 * Ensures:
1019 *
1020 * \li *nodep is NULL.
1021 */
1022
1023void
1024dns_db_transfernode(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t **sourcep,
1025 dns_dbnode_t **targetp);
1026/*%<
1027 * Transfer a node between pointer.
1028 *
1029 * This is equivalent to calling dns_db_attachnode() then dns_db_detachnode().
1030 *
1031 * Requires:
1032 *
1033 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
1034 *
1035 * \li '*sourcep' is a valid node.
1036 *
1037 * \li 'targetp' points to a NULL dns_dbnode_t *.
1038 *
1039 * Ensures:
1040 *
1041 * \li '*sourcep' is NULL.
1042 */
1043
1044isc_result_t
1045dns_db_expirenode(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t *node, isc_stdtime_t now);
1046/*%<
1047 * Mark as stale all records at 'node' which expire at or before 'now'.
1048 *
1049 * Note: if 'now' is zero, then the current time will be used.
1050 *
1051 * Requires:
1052 *
1053 * \li 'db' is a valid cache database.
1054 *
1055 * \li 'node' is a valid node.
1056 */
1057
1058void
1059dns_db_printnode(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t *node, FILE *out);
1060/*%<
1061 * Print a textual representation of the contents of the node to
1062 * 'out'.
1063 *
1064 * Note: this function is intended for debugging, not general use.
1065 *
1066 * Requires:
1067 *
1068 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
1069 *
1070 * \li 'node' is a valid node.
1071 */
1072
1073/***
1074 *** DB Iterator Creation
1075 ***/
1076
1077isc_result_t
1078dns_db_createiterator(dns_db_t *db, unsigned int options,
1079 dns_dbiterator_t **iteratorp);
1080/*%<
1081 * Create an iterator for version 'version' of 'db'.
1082 *
1083 * Notes:
1084 *
1085 * \li One or more of the following options can be set.
1086 * #DNS_DB_RELATIVENAMES
1087 * #DNS_DB_NSEC3ONLY
1088 * #DNS_DB_NONSEC3
1089 *
1090 * Requires:
1091 *
1092 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
1093 *
1094 * \li iteratorp != NULL && *iteratorp == NULL
1095 *
1096 * Ensures:
1097 *
1098 * \li On success, *iteratorp will be a valid database iterator.
1099 *
1100 * Returns:
1101 *
1102 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1103 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
1104 */
1105
1106/***
1107 *** Rdataset Methods
1108 ***/
1109
1110/*
1111 * XXXRTH Should we check for glue and pending data in dns_db_findrdataset()?
1112 */
1113
1114isc_result_t
1115dns_db_findrdataset(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t *node, dns_dbversion_t *version,
1116 dns_rdatatype_t type, dns_rdatatype_t covers,
1117 isc_stdtime_t now, dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
1118 dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset);
1119
1120/*%<
1121 * Search for an rdataset of type 'type' at 'node' that are in version
1122 * 'version' of 'db'. If found, make 'rdataset' refer to it.
1123 *
1124 * Notes:
1125 *
1126 * \li If 'version' is NULL, then the current version will be used.
1127 *
1128 * \li Care must be used when using this routine to build a DNS response:
1129 * 'node' should have been found with dns_db_find(), not
1130 * dns_db_findnode(). No glue checking is done. No checking for
1131 * pending data is done.
1132 *
1133 * \li The 'now' field is ignored if 'db' is a zone database. If 'db' is a
1134 * cache database, an rdataset will not be found unless it expires after
1135 * 'now'. If 'now' is zero, then the current time will be used.
1136 *
1137 * Requires:
1138 *
1139 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
1140 *
1141 * \li 'node' is a valid node.
1142 *
1143 * \li 'rdataset' is a valid, disassociated rdataset.
1144 *
1145 * \li 'sigrdataset' is a valid, disassociated rdataset, or it is NULL.
1146 *
1147 * \li If 'covers' != 0, 'type' must be RRSIG.
1148 *
1149 * \li 'type' is not a meta-RR type such as 'ANY' or 'OPT'.
1150 *
1151 * Ensures:
1152 *
1153 * \li On success, 'rdataset' is associated with the found rdataset.
1154 *
1155 * Returns:
1156 *
1157 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1158 * \li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND
1159 *
1160 * \li Other results are possible, depending upon the database
1161 * implementation used.
1162 */
1163
1164isc_result_t
1165dns_db_allrdatasets(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t *node, dns_dbversion_t *version,
1166 isc_stdtime_t now, dns_rdatasetiter_t **iteratorp);
1167/*%<
1168 * Make '*iteratorp' an rdataset iterator for all rdatasets at 'node' in
1169 * version 'version' of 'db'.
1170 *
1171 * Notes:
1172 *
1173 * \li If 'version' is NULL, then the current version will be used.
1174 *
1175 * \li The 'now' field is ignored if 'db' is a zone database. If 'db' is a
1176 * cache database, an rdataset will not be found unless it expires after
1177 * 'now'. Any ANY query will not match unless at least one rdataset at
1178 * the node expires after 'now'. If 'now' is zero, then the current time
1179 * will be used.
1180 *
1181 * Requires:
1182 *
1183 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
1184 *
1185 * \li 'node' is a valid node.
1186 *
1187 * \li iteratorp != NULL && *iteratorp == NULL
1188 *
1189 * Ensures:
1190 *
1191 * \li On success, '*iteratorp' is a valid rdataset iterator.
1192 *
1193 * Returns:
1194 *
1195 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1196 * \li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND
1197 *
1198 * \li Other results are possible, depending upon the database
1199 * implementation used.
1200 */
1201
1202isc_result_t
1203dns_db_addrdataset(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t *node, dns_dbversion_t *version,
1204 isc_stdtime_t now, dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
1205 unsigned int options, dns_rdataset_t *addedrdataset);
1206/*%<
1207 * Add 'rdataset' to 'node' in version 'version' of 'db'.
1208 *
1209 * Notes:
1210 *
1211 * \li If the database has zone semantics, the #DNS_DBADD_MERGE option is set,
1212 * and an rdataset of the same type as 'rdataset' already exists at
1213 * 'node' then the contents of 'rdataset' will be merged with the existing
1214 * rdataset. If the option is not set, then rdataset will replace any
1215 * existing rdataset of the same type. If not merging and the
1216 * #DNS_DBADD_FORCE option is set, then the data will update the database
1217 * without regard to trust levels. If not forcing the data, then the
1218 * rdataset will only be added if its trust level is >= the trust level of
1219 * any existing rdataset. Forcing is only meaningful for cache databases.
1220 * If #DNS_DBADD_EXACT is set then there must be no rdata in common between
1221 * the old and new rdata sets. If #DNS_DBADD_EXACTTTL is set then both
1222 * the old and new rdata sets must have the same ttl.
1223 *
1224 * \li The 'now' field is ignored if 'db' is a zone database. If 'db' is
1225 * a cache database, then the added rdataset will expire no later than
1226 * now + rdataset->ttl.
1227 *
1228 * \li If 'addedrdataset' is not NULL, then it will be attached to the
1229 * resulting new rdataset in the database, or to the existing data if
1230 * the existing data was better.
1231 *
1232 * Requires:
1233 *
1234 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
1235 *
1236 * \li 'node' is a valid node.
1237 *
1238 * \li 'rdataset' is a valid, associated rdataset with the same class
1239 * as 'db'.
1240 *
1241 * \li 'addedrdataset' is NULL, or a valid, unassociated rdataset.
1242 *
1243 * \li The database has zone semantics and 'version' is a valid
1244 * read-write version, or the database has cache semantics
1245 * and version is NULL.
1246 *
1247 * \li If the database has cache semantics, the #DNS_DBADD_MERGE option must
1248 * not be set.
1249 *
1250 * Returns:
1251 *
1252 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1253 * \li #DNS_R_UNCHANGED The operation did not change anything.
1254 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
1255 * \li #DNS_R_NOTEXACT
1256 *
1257 * \li Other results are possible, depending upon the database
1258 * implementation used.
1259 */
1260
1261isc_result_t
1262dns_db_subtractrdataset(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t *node,
1263 dns_dbversion_t *version, dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
1264 unsigned int options, dns_rdataset_t *newrdataset);
1265/*%<
1266 * Remove any rdata in 'rdataset' from 'node' in version 'version' of
1267 * 'db'.
1268 *
1269 * Notes:
1270 *
1271 * \li If 'newrdataset' is not NULL, then it will be attached to the
1272 * resulting new rdataset in the database, unless the rdataset has
1273 * become nonexistent. If DNS_DBSUB_EXACT is set then all elements
1274 * of 'rdataset' must exist at 'node'.
1275 *
1276 *\li If DNS_DBSUB_WANTOLD is set and the entire rdataset was deleted
1277 * then return the original rdatatset in newrdataset if that existed.
1278 *
1279 * Requires:
1280 *
1281 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
1282 *
1283 * \li 'node' is a valid node.
1284 *
1285 * \li 'rdataset' is a valid, associated rdataset with the same class
1286 * as 'db'.
1287 *
1288 * \li 'newrdataset' is NULL, or a valid, unassociated rdataset.
1289 *
1290 * \li The database has zone semantics and 'version' is a valid
1291 * read-write version.
1292 *
1293 * Returns:
1294 *
1295 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1296 * \li #DNS_R_UNCHANGED The operation did not change anything.
1297 * \li #DNS_R_NXRRSET All rdata of the same type as those
1298 * in 'rdataset' have been deleted.
1299 * \li #DNS_R_NOTEXACT Some part of 'rdataset' did not
1300 * exist and DNS_DBSUB_EXACT was set.
1301 *
1302 * \li Other results are possible, depending upon the database
1303 * implementation used.
1304 */
1305
1306isc_result_t
1307dns_db_deleterdataset(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t *node,
1308 dns_dbversion_t *version, dns_rdatatype_t type,
1309 dns_rdatatype_t covers);
1310/*%<
1311 * Make it so that no rdataset of type 'type' exists at 'node' in version
1312 * version 'version' of 'db'.
1313 *
1314 * Notes:
1315 *
1316 * \li If 'type' is dns_rdatatype_any, then no rdatasets will exist in
1317 * 'version' (provided that the dns_db_deleterdataset() isn't followed
1318 * by one or more dns_db_addrdataset() calls).
1319 *
1320 * Requires:
1321 *
1322 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
1323 *
1324 * \li 'node' is a valid node.
1325 *
1326 * \li The database has zone semantics and 'version' is a valid
1327 * read-write version, or the database has cache semantics
1328 * and version is NULL.
1329 *
1330 * \li 'type' is not a meta-RR type, except for dns_rdatatype_any, which is
1331 * allowed.
1332 *
1333 * \li If 'covers' != 0, 'type' must be SIG.
1334 *
1335 * Returns:
1336 *
1337 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1338 * \li #DNS_R_UNCHANGED No rdatasets of 'type' existed before
1339 * the operation was attempted.
1340 *
1341 * \li Other results are possible, depending upon the database
1342 * implementation used.
1343 */
1344
1345isc_result_t
1346dns_db_getsoaserial(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver, uint32_t *serialp);
1347/*%<
1348 * Get the current SOA serial number from a zone database.
1349 *
1350 * Requires:
1351 * \li 'db' is a valid database with zone semantics.
1352 * \li 'ver' is a valid version.
1353 */
1354
1355void
1356dns_db_overmem(dns_db_t *db, bool overmem);
1357/*%<
1358 * Enable / disable aggressive cache cleaning.
1359 */
1360
1361unsigned int
1362dns_db_nodecount(dns_db_t *db);
1363/*%<
1364 * Count the number of nodes in 'db'.
1365 *
1366 * Requires:
1367 *
1368 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
1369 *
1370 * Returns:
1371 * \li The number of nodes in the database
1372 */
1373
1374size_t
1375dns_db_hashsize(dns_db_t *db);
1376/*%<
1377 * For database implementations using a hash table, report the
1378 * current number of buckets.
1379 *
1380 * Requires:
1381 *
1382 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
1383 *
1384 * Returns:
1385 * \li The number of buckets in the database's hash table, or
1386 * 0 if not implemented.
1387 */
1388
1389void
1390dns_db_settask(dns_db_t *db, isc_task_t *task);
1391/*%<
1392 * If task is set then the final detach maybe performed asynchronously.
1393 *
1394 * Requires:
1395 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
1396 * \li 'task' to be valid or NULL.
1397 */
1398
1399bool
1400dns_db_ispersistent(dns_db_t *db);
1401/*%<
1402 * Is 'db' persistent? A persistent database does not need to be loaded
1403 * from disk or written to disk.
1404 *
1405 * Requires:
1406 *
1407 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
1408 *
1409 * Returns:
1410 * \li #true 'db' is persistent.
1411 * \li #false 'db' is not persistent.
1412 */
1413
1414isc_result_t
1415dns_db_register(const char *name, dns_dbcreatefunc_t create, void *driverarg,
1416 isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_dbimplementation_t **dbimp);
1417
1418/*%<
1419 * Register a new database implementation and add it to the list of
1420 * supported implementations.
1421 *
1422 * Requires:
1423 *
1424 * \li 'name' is not NULL
1425 * \li 'order' is a valid function pointer
1426 * \li 'mctx' is a valid memory context
1427 * \li dbimp != NULL && *dbimp == NULL
1428 *
1429 * Returns:
1430 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS The registration succeeded
1431 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY Out of memory
1432 * \li #ISC_R_EXISTS A database implementation with the same name exists
1433 *
1434 * Ensures:
1435 *
1436 * \li *dbimp points to an opaque structure which must be passed to
1437 * dns_db_unregister().
1438 */
1439
1440void
1441dns_db_unregister(dns_dbimplementation_t **dbimp);
1442/*%<
1443 * Remove a database implementation from the list of supported
1444 * implementations. No databases of this type can be active when this
1445 * is called.
1446 *
1447 * Requires:
1448 * \li dbimp != NULL && *dbimp == NULL
1449 *
1450 * Ensures:
1451 *
1452 * \li Any memory allocated in *dbimp will be freed.
1453 */
1454
1455isc_result_t
1456dns_db_getoriginnode(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbnode_t **nodep);
1457/*%<
1458 * Get the origin DB node corresponding to the DB's zone. This function
1459 * should typically succeed unless the underlying DB implementation doesn't
1460 * support the feature.
1461 *
1462 * Requires:
1463 *
1464 * \li 'db' is a valid zone database.
1465 * \li 'nodep' != NULL && '*nodep' == NULL
1466 *
1467 * Ensures:
1468 * \li On success, '*nodep' will point to the DB node of the zone's origin.
1469 *
1470 * Returns:
1471 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1472 * \li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND - the DB implementation does not support this feature.
1473 */
1474
1475isc_result_t
1476dns_db_getnsec3parameters(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *version,
1477 dns_hash_t *hash, uint8_t *flags,
1478 uint16_t *interations,
1479 unsigned char *salt, size_t *salt_length);
1480/*%<
1481 * Get the NSEC3 parameters that are associated with this zone.
1482 *
1483 * Requires:
1484 * \li 'db' is a valid zone database.
1485 *
1486 * Returns:
1487 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1488 * \li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND - the DB implementation does not support this feature
1489 * or this zone does not have NSEC3 records.
1490 */
1491
1492isc_result_t
1493dns_db_getsize(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *version, uint64_t *records,
1494 uint64_t *bytes);
1495/*%<
1496 * Get the number of records in the given version of the database as well
1497 * as the number bytes used to store those records.
1498 *
1499 * Requires:
1500 * \li 'db' is a valid zone database.
1501 * \li 'version' is NULL or a valid version.
1502 * \li 'records' is NULL or a pointer to return the record count in.
1503 * \li 'bytes' is NULL or a pointer to return the byte count in.
1504 *
1505 * Returns:
1506 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1507 * \li #ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED
1508 */
1509
1510isc_result_t
1511dns_db_findnsec3node(dns_db_t *db, const dns_name_t *name,
1512 bool create, dns_dbnode_t **nodep);
1513/*%<
1514 * Find the NSEC3 node with name 'name'.
1515 *
1516 * Notes:
1517 * \li If 'create' is true and no node with name 'name' exists, then
1518 * such a node will be created.
1519 *
1520 * Requires:
1521 *
1522 * \li 'db' is a valid database.
1523 *
1524 * \li 'name' is a valid, non-empty, absolute name.
1525 *
1526 * \li nodep != NULL && *nodep == NULL
1527 *
1528 * Ensures:
1529 *
1530 * \li On success, *nodep is attached to the node with name 'name'.
1531 *
1532 * Returns:
1533 *
1534 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1535 * \li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND If !create and name not found.
1536 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY Can only happen if create is true.
1537 *
1538 * \li Other results are possible, depending upon the database
1539 * implementation used.
1540 */
1541
1542isc_result_t
1543dns_db_setsigningtime(dns_db_t *db, dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
1544 isc_stdtime_t resign);
1545/*%<
1546 * Sets the re-signing time associated with 'rdataset' to 'resign'.
1547 *
1548 * Requires:
1549 * \li 'db' is a valid zone database.
1550 * \li 'rdataset' is or is to be associated with 'db'.
1551 * \li 'rdataset' is not pending removed from the heap via an
1552 * uncommitted call to dns_db_resigned().
1553 *
1554 * Returns:
1555 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1556 * \li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
1557 * \li #ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED - Not supported by this DB implementation.
1558 */
1559
1560isc_result_t
1561dns_db_getsigningtime(dns_db_t *db, dns_rdataset_t *rdataset, dns_name_t *name);
1562/*%<
1563 * Return the rdataset with the earliest signing time in the zone.
1564 * Note: the rdataset is version agnostic.
1565 *
1566 * Requires:
1567 * \li 'db' is a valid zone database.
1568 * \li 'rdataset' to be initialized but not associated.
1569 * \li 'name' to be NULL or have a buffer associated with it.
1570 *
1571 * Returns:
1572 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1573 * \li #ISC_R_NOTFOUND - No dataset exists.
1574 */
1575
1576void
1577dns_db_resigned(dns_db_t *db, dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
1578 dns_dbversion_t *version);
1579/*%<
1580 * Mark 'rdataset' as not being available to be returned by
1581 * dns_db_getsigningtime(). If the changes associated with 'version'
1582 * are committed this will be permanent. If the version is not committed
1583 * this change will be rolled back when the version is closed. Until
1584 * 'version' is either committed or rolled back, 'rdataset' can no longer
1585 * be acted upon by dns_db_setsigningtime().
1586 *
1587 * Requires:
1588 * \li 'db' is a valid zone database.
1589 * \li 'rdataset' to be associated with 'db'.
1590 * \li 'version' to be open for writing.
1591 */
1592
1593dns_stats_t *
1594dns_db_getrrsetstats(dns_db_t *db);
1595/*%<
1596 * Get statistics information counting RRsets stored in the DB, when available.
1597 * The statistics may not be available depending on the DB implementation.
1598 *
1599 * Requires:
1600 *
1601 * \li 'db' is a valid database (cache only).
1602 *
1603 * Returns:
1604 * \li when available, a pointer to a statistics object created by
1605 * dns_rdatasetstats_create(); otherwise NULL.
1606 */
1607
1608isc_result_t
1609dns_db_setcachestats(dns_db_t *db, isc_stats_t *stats);
1610/*%<
1611 * Set the location in which to collect cache statistics.
1612 * This option may not exist depending on the DB implementation.
1613 *
1614 * Requires:
1615 *
1616 * \li 'db' is a valid database (cache only).
1617 *
1618 * Returns:
1619 * \li when available, a pointer to a statistics object created by
1620 * dns_rdatasetstats_create(); otherwise NULL.
1621 */
1622
1623void
1624dns_db_rpz_attach(dns_db_t *db, void *rpzs, uint8_t rpz_num)
1625 ISC_DEPRECATED;
1626/*%<
1627 * Attach the response policy information for a view to a database for a
1628 * zone for the view.
1629 */
1630
1631isc_result_t
1632dns_db_rpz_ready(dns_db_t *db)
1633 ISC_DEPRECATED;
1634/*%<
1635 * Finish loading a response policy zone.
1636 */

1675 * \li 'node' and 'name' are not NULL

1677
1678isc_result_t
1679dns_db_setservestalettl(dns_db_t *db, dns_ttl_t ttl);
1680/*%<
1681 * Sets the maximum length of time that cached answers may be retained
1682 * past their normal TTL. Default value for the library is 0, disabling
1683 * the use of stale data.
1684 *
1685 * Requires:
1686 * \li 'db' is a valid cache database.
1687 * \li 'ttl' is the number of seconds to retain data past its normal expiry.
1688 *
1689 * Returns:
1690 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1691 * \li #ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED - Not supported by this DB implementation.
1692 */
1693
1694isc_result_t
1695dns_db_getservestalettl(dns_db_t *db, dns_ttl_t *ttl);
1696/*%<
1697 * Gets maximum length of time that cached answers may be kept past
1698 * normal TTL expiration.
1699 *
1700 * Requires:
1701 * \li 'db' is a valid cache database.
1702 * \li 'ttl' is the number of seconds to retain data past its normal expiry.
1703 *
1704 * Returns:
1705 * \li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
1706 * \li #ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED - Not supported by this DB implementation.
1707 */
1708
1709isc_result_t
1710dns_db_setgluecachestats(dns_db_t *db, isc_stats_t *stats);
1711/*%<
1712 * Set the location in which to collect glue cache statistics.
1713 * This option may not exist depending on the DB implementation.
1714 *
1715 * Requires:
1716 *
1717 * \li 'db' is a valid database (cache only).
1718 *
1719 * Returns:
